theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Environmentally Regulated Programmed Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory emphasizes external environmental cues and population-level adaptive regulation of lifespan, fitting the theme of environmental modulation of programmed aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing and Metabolic Regulation Programmed Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on nutrient sensing pathways (insulin/IGF-1, mTOR, AMPK, sirtuins) and dietary interventions regulating aging, fitting nutrient/metabolic regulation mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nutrient Sensing and Metabolic Regulation Programmed Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes longevity programs regulated by nutrient sensing pathways and environmental cues, emphasizing metabolic and signaling control of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Adaptive Programmed Death and Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on programmed death (phenoptosis) as an adaptive evolutionary mechanism, fitting evolutionary and population-level programmed aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Endocrine Regulation Programmed Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genetic control and endocrine/immunological regulation of aging, highlighting gene regulation and systemic hormonal control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere and Subtelomere-Based Programmed Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on telomere shortening and subtelomere repression as programmed aging mechanisms, a distinct molecular genetic subcluster.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Environmental Sensory Neuron-Regulated Programmed Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on temperature sensing via thermosensory neurons regulating genetic aging programs, highlighting environmental sensory regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Epigenetic Programmed Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes aging as genetically and epigenetically programmed with a balance of damage and repair, fitting genetic/epigenetic regulation mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Epigenetic Programmed Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genetic clocks, epigenetic regulation, and conserved signaling pathways controlling aging, fitting genetic/epigenetic programming.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Adaptive Programmed Death and Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Includes programmed longevity as an evolved program within evolutionary theories, fitting the evolutionary adaptive theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Epigenetic Programmed Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on epigenetic clocks, conserved molecular pathways, and programmed cell death mechanisms, fitting genetic/epigenetic programming.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Adaptive Programmed Death and Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes programmed aging as an evolved mechanism with population-level benefits, emphasizing evolutionary mechanics.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on polygenic and epistatic genetic control of lifespan variability, fitting genetic regulation mechanisms.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes IGF-1 signaling activating mitophagy to prevent cellular aging, linking nutrient signaling to mitochondrial quality control.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on evolutionary basis of programmed aging with biological clocks and signaling, fitting evolutionary adaptive mechanisms.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Presents programmed death as an evolutionary adaptation in spatially structured populations, fitting evolutionary adaptive theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic and Epigenetic Programmed Longevity Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Compares variability in aging and developmental events supporting programmed biological timing, fitting genetic/epigenetic programming.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes GH/IGF-I deficiency affecting brain metabolism and aging, linking nutrient/hormonal signaling to aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes genetic program for lifespan limitation with evolutionary rationale, fitting evolutionary adaptive programmed aging.
